Articles.Content:
Hello,

I have a little question - how can I change the triangles on the symmetry mode button into numbers? I have KSP installed on one PC, where the button has numbers (1x, 2x etc.), but when I installed or even copied the game into another PC, then the symmetry mode is just numbers.

Image for what I'm talking about (click for big)

Thanks for your time,

SpaceSheep

Edited April 25, 2013 by SpaceSheep

I don't know what happened, but I can't seem to see any content, aka my post has disappeared after I clicked "Edit". Anyways:

Image of what I'm talking about:

What's going on: I've got KSP 0.18.4 version on one PC, where the symmetry mode is represented by numbers (1x, 2x, etc.), but when I install or copy the game to my other PC then all I see are the triangles. How can I change it so it'd be numbers on both my PC-s?
As far as I know the numbers come from Deadbeefs edtools... Its floating around somewhere. I forget what threads I have seen it in. You can probably find it if you search "Deadbeef edtools"

are you running vanilla or have you intalled mods? I do know that that the editor tools mod changes both the symmetry and snap to angle icons into numbers.

EDIT: Ninja'd

Edited April 25, 2013 by Sol_Rokks_Teddy
Thank you very much! I've looked for deadbeefs edtools, however it doesn't seem to be quite the same thing..

Here it is.

The forum thread for Editor Tools got eaten, but I still have the download link in my history. I assure you this is what you're thinking of.

Cheers!
Oh my, thank you so very much! It's exactly what I was looking for! I don't know how did the plugin get lost in the transfer, but now it's back to convenient - yay ^^,
